Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Sara56537
Reviews.Content: The hotel has only been open for a few short months, but there are some great qualities emerging already. The building and facilities are beautiful! Contempory without compromising comfort. The location is fabulous: close to Millenium park, Nave pier and the Miraculous mile. What really stood out to me was the friendliness of the staff, especially Al in the conference rooms. Usually the wait staff at conventions are silent, Al interacted with everyone and was so fun! We specifically made sure we sat at his table. Al was great, but ALL the banquet staff went above and beyond as far as service and friendliness. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to downtown Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel downtown, hands down”
Reviews.Author: EricanChris
Reviews.Content: My husband an I just recently stayed at the Radisson Blu for a long weekend and are thoroughly impressed by this hotel! The rooms are beautiful, the staff is friendly and helpful, and Filini inside the hotel is a MUST! We are already planning our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “New Chicago Favorite”
Reviews.Author: Runtosun
Reviews.Content: Perfect room design, fabulous balconies, and an airy, modern feel make this my new Chicago favorite for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago's new hot spot”
Reviews.Author: ally k
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing! I discovered it after a Groupon deal and it was totally worth it. The hotel is beautiful- chic and modern. The bar and restaurant were both delicious. They were packed every night with locals and hotel guest. Breakfast at the hotel restaurant was great! Great location, only a couple blocks from Michigan Avenue and State Street.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Luxury”
Reviews.Author: LaurieAnnJayne
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel on business. The room was fabulous, service outstanding and the food upscale. My room was 1514 and it was quiet and clean. I lived the business and fitness centers and the free wireless. My only complaint was the speed of the wireless, which was painfully slow in both the room and the conference areas.

Reviews.Title: “Superb new hotel with modern flair”
Reviews.Author: Smonkee
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and our room was not ready yet. We were offered a fantastic room upgrade for a nominal bit extra. The room was a stunning corner room with great views from the balcony. The gym and rec room were fantastic. Can't wait to go back. All my future trips to Chicago will be booked with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: karkkisaari
Reviews.Content: Loved it! However, as a Nordic Radisson user did miss the super breakfast buffet. Also had diffiiculties with the shower which has to be used anti-clock wise (eventhough blue hot water "dot" indicates that you should use the handle pushing it to left)...this was confusing after a 20hrs flight... the maintenance guy did come up to check the shower but missed telling me the "trick" -so undressed again was left standing with cold water only... Only after a good nights sleep was able to figure this out by myself :) Housekeeping knocked my door twice during my stay without indicating whose behind the door(?). (as a senior lecturer in hotel management I'm particular in these things, sorry) F&B staff smiling and very helpfull! Great location and nice interior. I will return!

Reviews.Title: “Admired Much. Slept Little.”
Reviews.Author: PiecesDesigner
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a night's stay at the Radisson Blu Hotel. We were in town for a concert that evening and were quite tired and in desperate need of a quick nap when we checked into our room. Catching any sleep was an impossibility. Maybe it was the fact that our room was located in a small alcove. Maybe it was because we were near an elevator, or perhaps it was the ice machine outside our door or housekeeping station next to us. Regardless, I think we had the noisiest location in the hotel. We heard every sound as though it were coming from inside our room. Normally when staying in a room like this I'm able to make things work by using the fan as white noise. Having the fan on high didn't help the problem at all. Coming back from our concert around 11 PM, the noise wasn't any better. The last time I looked at the clock it was near 2 AM. I made mention of the noise during checkout and the only suggestion was to request a room away from the ice machine when making future reservations. This is a very good tip for those who are considering a stay at this hotel - something I wish I knew beforehand. It was our only true disappointment. The room itself was stunning, cutting edge and lovely to be in, but the eye candy wears off easily if you cannot rest (which is the purpose of staying in a hotel in the first place.) As for parking, there is a garage adjacent to the hotel, which is what we used. It is less expensive than valet, but there are no in/out privileges, so if you intend to use your car at all, go with the valet service. You'll come out ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Blu delivers anything but the "blues"”
Reviews.Author: lchandler4285
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room here for the weekend in March 2012. We traveled to Chicago from Indianapolis to intercept my daughter who was there on business. All the previous reviews are correct: the hotel is in a great location, the lobby and restaurant areas are interesting to look at, and conducive to hanging out to have a cocktail, the rooms are generously sized (for Chicago), the lap pool and exercise facilities are top-notch,and the in-room amenities are great. We ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant called Filini and the breakfast choices were different and very European: loved it! It was within easy walking distance to Millenium Park, The Art Institute of Chicago, as well as the "Mile". I have two negatives about the hotel. The parking garage is poorly marked. We were pretty tired when we came from Indianapolis on Friday night, so that may have been part of it. However, the next day it was just as baffling to maneuver in and out of the garage. It is not a dealbreaker because as the weekend went by, we did get better with the process. We are not easily confused people, but it was slightly annoying to deal with the maze they call a parking garage. The other negative (other reviewers have complained about this too) is the thermostat being right by the hotel window. As a result of this, it is extremely difficult to regulate the temperature in the room. I woke up a couple of times the first night trying to set the thermostat so we wouldn't bake. Neither one of my negatives should stop you from staying here. I would recommend this hotel to anyone I know in Indianapolis considering a stay in CHicago. Well done Radisson!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: J W
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Great staff! Great decor! Great beds! Great view! I can't say enough about this hotel. All this made for a perfect stay. The CVS on the lower level is very convenient. The rooms are a bit on the small side but designed so well you have everything you need. There really isn't anything I can comlain about with this hotel. I would recommed it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: JMom249
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to love this hotel. With the great reviews and description on the website, I was really excited about staying here. However, as I listen to the elevator as it dings constantly, I am truly disappointed. Why, oh why, is it necessary to ding everytime it stops? I have never been in a hotel that has the elevator do that. Also, my door doesn't close properly. I can barely get in unless I push down extremely hard on the handle. Once inside the room, I have to put my entire weight against the door to be able to close it properly and lock it. Then when I leave, I have to put my entire weight against it to unlock while slamming it shut to make sure it closes when I leave. That is simply ridiculous. I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: AusKMac
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Radisson Blu Aqua on business, and can highly recommend it for a business or leisure stay in Chicago. I found the rooms great value for money, the gym is MASSIVE, the rooms are good size and the bathrooms are very modern, the service at reception and in the restaurant is fantastic. And only one block from Michigan Ave, I'm definitely staying here next time I'm in Chicago!!

Reviews.Title: “Favourite Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Kaerolin
Reviews.Content: I had no complaints at all. The room was beautiful, clean, quiet and comfortable. The bathroom also was beautiful and clean. Wifi was fast. I was located 15 floors directly above a fire station and had no problems any of the 4 nights I was there with noise. It's a quiet location but walking distance to Michigan Ave, Millenium Park, the Loop, and a beautiful new market. Best gym facilities of any hotel I've stayed at in Chicago (of 10). New favourite for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Deneys
Reviews.Content: A great choice- well located and well priced. The rooms are brand new and the facilities are great. Hotel is paperless so that I found unique and the gym/ spa facilities are great- even have an outdoor running track! Highly recommended and just a good hotel- well done!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: Oggen
Reviews.Content: Stayed a weekend in January. Beautiful rooms, though the doors in the bathrooms are a bit unusual and not so pratical... But nice design. The coffee machine in the room is great. Ordrer room service on my first night and it arrived promptly and was very nice. Had breakfast there every day and I felt the value for money was good - great service by the breakfast staff. Reception staff was also verey firendly and the door man is such a nice guy! Had dinner in the Filini restaurant one night and the food was great, but there was a cold wind coming from the windows - so if the night is cold I recommend asking for a table away from the windows. Location: great - walking distance to everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place! Work or fun!”
Reviews.Author: ChiMom
Reviews.Content: I travel to Chicago often, but I don't often review the hotels because let's face it - Most Chicago hotels have small rooms, dark hallways and that "musty" building smell. The Radisson Blue Aqua was NONE of these things. My city-view room actually had a view of the city! The rooms were large and comfortable with a great desk space, VERY comfortable bed with superior linens and love the squishy pillows. The wonderful lighting options in the room were a great benefit. The furnishings were modern without giving an "Ikea modern" vibe. The bathroom was fabulous with a chic glass door walk-in shower that I now depserately want in my own home. :-) There was also great light in the hallways which are lined with fun wall art. Best of all? It was quiet. Peope were coming and going, but the solidly built room ensured those noises didn't impact me. I arrived early for check-in and they greeted me promptly, they found me a room and even escorted me to the elevators. My room service lunch was delicious and the concierge recommened Asian cuisine was a divine (and delivered!) dinner. I attended an on-site conference the second day. The food at the conference FAR surpassed that which has been provided at other conference sites (hotels & clubs) in the city. The servers at our conference also far surpassed the typical service. They were attentive, helpful, respectful and friendly. And when I left something behind? They Fed-Exed it to me next day! I have a new favorite work hotel and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting an exciting night on the town - just for fun. They have really done a great job here. Go check them out!

Reviews.Title: “A Breath of Fresh Air”
Reviews.Author: Luis T
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent business traveler throughout the United States and I get to Chicago at least half a dozen times each year. As a creature of habit and loyal to quality brands I typically stay in the same hotels and even the same rooms. I recently received an e-mail from the good folks at Club Carlson about the Radisson Blu in the Windy City and decided to try it out. First of all, itâ€™s a great location in downtown Chicago with great views from just about every angle and a short walk from the CTA. A short walk across Wacker will put you right on Michigan Avenue and the Magnificent Mile. Upon entering the hotel you will find a modern and attractive lobby â€“ much like a W Hotel minus the â€œcheesyâ€� factor. For germaphobes like me, the wooden floors are perfect and perfectly clean as is the bathroom. The lighting is plentiful, the beds really comfortable, and the best part is that the TV channels are mostly in HD. I was assigned a corner room on the 16th floor with a balcony and plenty of windows. The staff could not have been nicer or more accommodating. This is not your daddyâ€™s Radisson â€“ itâ€™s a whole new and refreshing experience â€“ particularly for those of us who canâ€™t be home most of the time, but can â€˜come homeâ€™ to a really comfortable and classy setting.

Reviews.Title: “Above expectations- which were already set VERY high”
Reviews.Author: Megan N
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely outstanding... I cannot say enough good things about the staff and the property. The hotel was conveniently located right next to shopping, great restaurants, and local tourism, my mother and I walked everywhere! The staff was more than accommodating giving us directions, helping us with luggage, and making us feel right at home! The Aqua Blu is THE best hotel experience I have ever had. We stayed for two nights and I wish that it would have been longer. In the morning we went down to the restaurant and had their breakfast which was simply delightful, the spin off of eggs benedict was great! While staying here I used all of the amenities such as the indoor pool and hot tub, bar, restaurant, room service, luggage storage, and fitness room. Everything and everyone could not have been more perfect! I will be back here, very soon because of the excellent service!! THANK YOU RADISSON AQUA BLU

Reviews.Title: “Modern Chic hotel in the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly S
Reviews.Content: The newly remodeled Blu Aqua hotel is divine! You will be amazed. Superb service, including room service at 4am was a lifesaver. Tapas at in-house restaurant Filini were a great start to our night out on the town. Everything was wireless so you could look at the TV for room service menu and for checkout. Bathroom was amazing...separate tub and shower and door to enclose toilet were convenient. Great decor, bathrobe in room, nice bathroom amenities, very modern. I would live there. They even have condo residences as well. Hardwood floors and wine glasses in the room. The lighting options in the room were great. View was great from room 1207. We could see Navy Pier and the river. Book it now if you want to impress your significant other.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: linfrangat
Reviews.Content: Cons: Hotel did not provide promised room upgrade for Club Carlson Gold membership, despite that the hotel was not full or even busy this weekend. Our room was dark and ultra modern and decor was not to my taste - no choice offered at check-in for a more traditional (or larger) room. The table-top sign which indicated that I wanted the bed linens changed was tiny and not noticed until the next day. I could not figure out how to turn on the body sprayer in the shower. Not adequate space to store towels in the bathroom so they were just haphazardly piled on the ledge. Pros: Hotel did feel new and very trendy/hip. Location was excellent. Helpful to have so many sets of elevators to access guest floors. Also enjoyed the multiple lounge and relaxation areas throughout the hotel, including the vending and television area near the pools. Very unique flooring and carpet color in our guest room. Doormen were very attentive and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Hip & Modern -- but not pretentious”
Reviews.Author: jpmom2boys
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 2/17/12. Took our two boys downtown for a night in the city. Sometimes when a hotel is hip, the staff can have a 'whatever' attitude - kind of, 'I'm too cool for you....' But not here. The modern vibe of the Radisson is complimented by a welcoming & friendly staff. Our room was on the 10th floor - black onyx/granite floors - with an bright aqua carpet. Excellent lighting, top of the line fixtures. Our room had a balcony, although it was too cold out to enjoy. Wonderful views of Navy Pier and the Lake Michigan. Beds were comfy - 2 queens, rather than 2 double - which is hard to find. One thing we noticed is the doorways to the rooms are not right off the hallway - they are tucked back - you go down a little hallway to the doors to the rooms. This makes the rooms very quiet. No noise from the hallways at all. Being a new hotel, everything is shiny and in excellent condition. The lobby is beautiful, with the long (very long) fireplace and comfy chairs. The lounge, bar and restaurant are modern; decorated in white, gray & silvery tones. We had lunch at Filini - the restaurant. Excellent food. Sandwiches were reasonable (around $10) but the other options were pricey for lunch. ($8-$12 for appy, $16 and up for entree - most averaging $23). Lunch for the four of us was $120 (we did have a couple glasses of wine). Our boys loved the game room (pool table) and 1/2 basketball court. The gym is better equipped than any hotel we have ever stayed.... but it is shared with the residents of the Aqua building. We were there on two occasions, and it wasn't crowded. Steam room and Sauna are also available. We really loved this hotel. Then again, it is brand, spanking new. I hope that they keep up with the maintenance of the property - keeping it fresh and clean. Great location -- close to the river, Millennium Park. Only complaint -- parking. $53. OUCH. Goes with the territory of city hotels, I know. But it still gets to me. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “many cool things at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: pozdowny
Reviews.Content: we spent one night here for an in town mini vacation. the rooms are very modern with hardwood floors. comfy bed and pillows, huge bathroom with a rain shower head and a wand attachment that i couldn't figure out how to use. there's a CVS store downstairs open til midnight, that comes in handy to keep out of the expensive mini bar. staff was friendly. the pool and hot tub were ok,but the steam room was really cool and something you don't see too often in a hotel. another cool part---half court basketball!!! the fitness center is open all night which is where the steam room and court are--super cool. a great location right by the trains and millennium park . this is a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Dawn B
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Radisson Blu Aqua Hotel for a long weekend. We have stayed at many hotels in Chicago and Milwaukee but this hotel is definitely a gem. The hotel is newly opened but did not feel like there was any inexperience at all. Fillini restaurant was wonderful and Michael was extremely helpful in making our breakfast delightful. The poached egg with salmon bacon was exquisite! Archtecturally, this hotel is stunning and the lobby sitting area with the full length horizontal fireplace is so comforting. We sat there each night with a drink and it was so relaxing. The rooms are really spacious and have a safe, full bar, rain fall shower and very comfortable beds. I cannot say enough about the weight room, athletic equipment, half basketball court and lap pool. We spent half of our time in that area and I never played so much "horse" in the basketball court as I did that weekend. The lap pool is perfect temperature for doing laps. i can't wait to stay in the summer to experience the outdoor track and pool! The lighting in the rooms and bathrooms are a bit dark. The room had a balcony which is also nice surprise in a hotel. The location is perfect for going to Navy Pier or the shopping district.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny”
Reviews.Author: Sarah H
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because it looked modern and I wanted to have a decent view if I was going to stay in downtown Chicago. I booked it to surprise my boyfriend for Valentines day, and I was not disappointed. I led him in and you could just see his eyes pop. The building itself is exquisite, but once you're inside the atmosphere is warm, modern, and exciting. The staff were excellent, very pleasant and helpful, and I really felt like they wanted our stay to be the best it could possibly be. We stayed in a Park Suite, which I didn't realize until I checked in, came with free access to the Business Lounge on the seventeenth floor. Great surprise! The continental breakfast served there was another fun perk. The room itself was beautiful, with wood floors, and it smelled very fresh the moment you walked in. Everything was clean, and the decor was perfect. Loved every bit of it. Now, of course, as you can expect, there are deals out there, but if you intend to ransack the minibar or order roomservice, you'll be paying plenty extra. But as I've already said, this place is worth every penny. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite building in Chicago... beautiful inside and out”
Reviews.Author: wheresheroams
Reviews.Content: The Aqua building has always been my favourite building in Chicago, and when I saw a Groupon for the new Radisson hotel that opened there I bought 2 nights immediately. The hotel is very modern - the rooms are immaculate with clean lines and minimalistic design. Loved the radio/dock for our iPod which also included an aux port for my Android. I used the free WiFi to connect to Sirius to play in the room which was an added bonus. I bought the upgrade waiting list option for a corner room with King Bed. Totally worth it at the discounted rate of $20 a night. We were on the 5th floor, so the view wasn't that great, but I was just thrilled to be IN the buildling. We could see a sliver of the park and Navy Pier. Because it was Feb, the outdoor poor was closed - but you could tell that it must be lovely in the summer time. There is an indoor lap pool but there are only 2 lanes, so it's a bit limited. There is also a super hot spa (jacuzzi) there and a port for your iPod so you can play your own music while enjoying the pool/hot tub. The pillows were very soft - but comfy for us. The bed also very comfy. The toiletries were nice, though I found the conditioner wasn't that great even though it was "Made in France". The shower is funky - with a rain-style shower head, and an secondary Chrome shower handle. The door men are very friendly, and the lounge/Filini bar are very funky. The bathrooms on the main floor are really crazy - with mirrored tile covering the walls from floor to ceiling. Location is great - very close to Michigan, but on a quiet street so very little vehicle traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: DKCZONE
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the weekend and the hotel is pretty amazing. When we arrived we were welcomed by a friendly doorman (Bob) who helped us with our bags and escorted us to the Front Desk to check in. The gentleman that checked us in was very nice and professional and explained all the details to us. We were brought up to our room by the door or bellman. The room decor was not our taste. It was very dark and just not our preference so we called the Front Desk after spending a few minutes in the room and were politly offered to move to another room. The new room was much lighter, very clean and we loved it. The lobby is amazing. They have a 50ft long fire place with a loungy area in front which is great to enjoy some drinks at night. The bar seemed busy but we still got served in a timely manner. Server was very friendly as well. However during our stay we did have several issues with room service and the housekeeping service. We ordered breakfast Saturday and were waiting and waiting and waiting. An hour passed, we called and they told us they have not gotten an order from our room! Are you kidding me? They then took our order a second time and promised the food will be up shortly. After we finished breakfast we called to ask housekeeping to clean our room and asked the concierge on our way out for some sightseeing tips. He also gave us some great recommendations for dinner that night. We came back to the hotel after exploring Chicago only to find a dirty room that has not been cleaned yet. We were pretty annoyed by that fact because we were planning on getting ready for dinner. They have a fancy system on their TV's that supposley show you the room service menu and information about the hotel which didn't work as well. For Sunday morning we asked for a wake up call at 8am that we never received as well. I understand that the hotel is brand new and they are still working out the issues but we could have missed our flight if we would not have set our alarm ourselves. Anyway, when we came down to the Front Desk to check out, we met one of the nicest employees ever. Jessica was the manager that morning and she was so understanding and helpful. She offered several solutions and was simply outstanding. We were a little disappointed when we came down to check out but by the time we left we forgot about all the issues due to excellent service from your manager. She is a keeper! If we visit Chicago again we will definitely be back and give the hotel another try.

Reviews.Title: “modern hotel in a great spot”
Reviews.Author: Gbmyers
Reviews.Content: The Blu is a modern hotel with well appointed rooms. There's two free bottles of water every day in the room, which is becoming more and more rare in hotels. I was here for a business trip with lots of catered meetings, and the food was always good with a wide variety. The meeting spaces are easy to get to and well equipped. Internet access was free in the rooms but never worked in the meeting areas. Cell phone coverage is terrible here though.

Reviews.Title: “Location, staff, room all A+”
Reviews.Author: SharonLee645
Reviews.Content: Just spent a thoroughly delightful stay at Radisson Blu Aqua. I have admired the design since it opened and Jeanne Gang, the architect deserves high praise. Aqua stands out on the Chicago skyline. I was on the 10th floor and the city view from my balcony was grand. The lobby is gorgeous as are the rooms. I found the staff very friendly and helpful. The location is great - close to wonderful restaurants, Harris Theater of Music and Dance, just off Michigan Avenue. I have already booked two more visits.

Reviews.Title: “Nice atmosphere and awesome hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: Cu_Gu
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at the Radisson Blu Aqua.Modern rooms with comfortable beds, it was not so easy to go up in the morning. The lobby is cosy with the fireplace, and I recomend to eat and drink at the Fellinis bar and resturant with nice service. They also have a really good Fitness center with full gym equipment and pool.The staff on this hotel is very serviceminded and seems truly love to work here And I will definitely visit this hotel next time I am in Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice but Some Teething Problems”
Reviews.Author: Itrepid_Canadian
Reviews.Content: The hotel opened in November 2011. It has a great location, downtown Chicago, across from the Fairmont. The facilities are new, of course, and it has everything. Staff are friendly and helpful. Their computer system needs a bit of work though. We booked for three nights, and when we arrived were told our checkout was the next day. We re-confirmed for three nights, but got a bill the first night indicating we were checking out the next day. We got that straightened out for one room, but a couple of others had the problem every day. That said, I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome hotel but lacks adequate parking!”
Reviews.Author: sully63
Reviews.Content: Having had the opportunity to stay at many Chicago hotels in this price range, I found the Raddison Blu to be a breath of fresh air. Itâ€™s distinctly Scandinavian flavor provides a pleasant twist on the concept of a luxury hotel. This hotel is fairly new and at the time of this writing, great deals can still be found while this hotel introduces itself to the area. The hotel was very clean, as one would expect in a newer hotel. The hotel itself shares space and some of the amenities with residents who live on the other side of the building and have a separate bank of elevators. The main lobby was spacious and understated with a gas fire feature that runs the length stone accent wall; just the thing after walking around the city on a cold January evening. Across from the lobby is the Hotel Bar and restaurant; again tastefully done with a distinctly Scandinavian accent. Unfortunately, I did not have an opportunity to spend time in the Bar or order from the Hotelâ€™s menu, but I did attend an event in the hotel during my stay and the food was fantastic. From the Angus Sliders to the gnocchi & ravioli bar, the food was well prepared and flavorful, my compliment to the chefs! The Room was not large, but it was comfortable and the view of Navy Pier was fantastic!. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was what you would expect in a luxury hotel, and combined elements of white porcelain and frosted glass that remained true to the hotelâ€™s theme. This hotel has it all, a large workout room, at least one pool that I saw, a running track and a basketball court, I wanted for nothing during my stayâ€¦â€¦..ok except for maybe one thingâ€¦â€¦â€¦parking. The hotel shares parking with the resident side of the building and many of the spots in the 5 level parking lots are reserved. I drove up and down for 30 minutes before I parked questionably close, but not blocking, an exit door. Some of my travel companions opted for the valet parking and thatâ€™s an option. If youâ€™re driving Iâ€™d recommend you do that!

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: HayleyBons
Reviews.Content: I called the Raddison Blu Aqua Hotel recently to book a room; when I initially contacted the hotel I was quoted one rate. I decided that I wanted to compare and then make a decision. I then called the hotel an hour later and a woman in reservations informed me the room was gone. This didn't make sense to me because despite the hotel being a "hot spot" I couldn't imagine that room being gone so quickly. She told me the manager would tell me the same thing (so basically there's no point). I wanted to stay at The Raddison Blu Aqua Hotel, so I decided to book the hotel at the available rate (which was higher). After getting off of the phone with the rude lady, I decided to call right back. This is where it gets interesting! I spoke with a young lady by the name of Lindsey, and she was absolutely AMAZING! I asked her if the room I initially wanted was available and she informed me it was! I told her I just spoke to reservations and they said it was gone... but, it really wasn't. Basically, Lindsey was so sweet I decided not to cancel my reservation. *****NOTE: BEFORE YOU RESERVE YOUR ROOM MAKE SURE YOU HAVE THE BEST GUARANTEED PRICE! IT MAY TAKE SOME CONSISTENCY BUT, IT'S WORTH IT. THEY NEVER GIVE YOU THE LOWEST GUARANTEED PRICE VOLUNTARILY. YOU MUST ASK (SOMETIMES TWICE).*********

Reviews.Title: “Modern and unique”
Reviews.Author: Aimeeyso
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern rooms with nice details. Great views of the city- feels like an apt rather than hotel. So new. Perks and free drinks. Lobby is very cool. Ambiance. Check in was nice- very accommodating. Check out was odd- gentleman at desk was rude and shoved us off on very nice young lady.

Reviews.Title: “If I could give it 0 stars I would!”
Reviews.Author: Andrew P
Reviews.Content: Let's just start by saying the staff are one of the most unhelpful groups ever assembled. You will see this theme throughout this review. I do a ton of business with my local Radisson in Bothell (Seattle) Washington. I "won" two free nights at Blu during a holiday event. I was to receive a park view room on the business class floor. My GPS placed me below the hotel and when I called to get directions on how to get to the surface, the reply from the staff was "We don't drive here sir, so we don't know how to get here". You think they would ask somebody? Hell no! So I drove around for an hour finally getting to the surface and to the hotel. I was then forced to illegally park in the alley to go check in because there was no room to park, or no designated area for people who want to check in. Check in went fine and then, I got to my "room". It was literally the size of a small office. The view??? A big ugly office building!!! So I look at the fire escape map and see they gave me the tiniest room available, tucked away in a corner. It was about 30% smaller than the other rooms. So I go downstairs, ready to check out. There were suites available at the Crowne Plaza just 10 minutes away. Begrudginly and I mean begrudginly, the desk person offered up another room. I asked if it was "park view" as promised by my certificate, and they said "no". I explained that I had reserved park view two weeks earlier. They said "First come, first served" and they gave away the room that I reserved!!!! So, anyhow, long story short, I took the new room, which was larger, and made the best of it. As others have said, they put the themostat right by the window, so the room baked no matter how low you put the temp. The food was bland and expensive and their business lounge was an absolute joke. The Holiday Inn Express does a better job at breakfast and happy hour than this place did. Maybe hipsters that enjoy a ton of style with very little substance may enjoy this property, but I prefer a hotel where guests are treated with respect, reservations are kept, rooms are modern AND spacious and the "extras" really are extra. I am severly disappointed with my stay at the Rasisson Blu and I would highly recommend you look elsewhere for the Chicago experience. This place sucked!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer service”
Reviews.Author: Mark F
Reviews.Content: We visited the Blu Aqua thanks to a Groupon offer introducing the hotel. We loved everything about the hotel (except the fact that the couch in our suite was very uncomfortable). We had a park view suite and enjoyed stepping out onto the balcony for some fresh air. The design of the rooms was quite unique, but very functional as well. The large flat screen TV's and free wi-fi were great additions as well. Aside from the magnificent room, however, the best part of our visit may have been the service. We spoke to the doorman, Bob, on several occasions and received many great tips and recomendations on nearby eateries and activities. The whole staff was very pleasant and attentive throughout our stay. The wall length firplace in the lobby is a site to see, along with the "candle lit" tables in the Filini Lounge. The workout area looked amazing, although we didn't have to to try it out. The parking cost is a bit high at $53/night, but not really out of line with Chicago standards. Our only other complaint, albeit a minor one, was with the minibar/fridge. We were warned by both the desk clerk and bellman that the items were actually on some type of timer. If an item was removed and later put back a charge would still show up on the bill. We were told it was easy enough to have them taken back off, but not really a hassle I wanted to go through at checkout. We had been hoping to chill some wine in the fridge, but didn't know how many items we would displace in the process! Overall though, the hotel was quite amazing and definitely a place we will return to in the future.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at the Radisson Blu Aqua!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mida0503
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Blu Aqua is a fabulous hotel located in the heart of downtown Chicago just off Millennium Park. Absolutely the cleanest room ever, beautiful bath, great bed and balconies with a lovely view of the park. The Filini Lounge is beautiful and the service superb. The indoor pool and excercise room are great. We loved everything about our stay and would highly recommend this hotel. Check it out if you are coming to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: TXN60613
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel on December 26, 2011 for one night. The hotel itself is sleek and modern and new. I was given an upgraded corner room with a balcony facing south and west. The views from the room are amazing. My hotel and my room had a great design aesthetic, but my room wasn't fully serviced when I checked in (the trash cans were full and the toilet obviously hadn't been cleaned). After informing the front desk, housekeeping came up 2.5 hours later -- when I was in bed. The desk layout isn't conducive to a productive work day. I slept pretty well that night and didn't hear any hallway noise. The next morning I informed the front desk folks about my issues and they were great, offering several solutions. Bottom line, I paid $140 for a room in an amazing area, just off Michigan Avenue. I would recommend staying here again -- just know you are not staying at a 5-Star Hotel. You can see my full review with many photos at http://landtt.blogspot.com/2012/01/radisson-blu-chicago-hotel-review.html

Reviews.Title: “Great location for tourist and business alike”
Reviews.Author: yoyofella
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Chicago for New Years Eve, and we were enticed by the new and renowned Aqua building and decided to splurge and stay at the slightly more expensive Radisson Aqua. Room choices: You get a choice of City View (facing north and west) vs. Park view (facing east and south). I believe both sides should have good view, but I upgraded to a Park View corner room with because I wanted to see the New Year Eve firework close to Navy Pier. The corner room is a slightly larger room than the typical one and has a wrap-around balcony so you can see to sides of the city (I have some reservation about this "upgrade", will elaborate later). Other choices you can have is with and without balcony. For those without chilldren, I will definite recommend the room with Balcony because it's nice to be able to go outside. However, those with kids should probably forgo that option as I can definitely imagine a kid can climb over that rail and fall over. The hotel cover the first 20 floor of the Aqua tower, and since it's in downtown Chicago, I definitely recommend asking for room in the higher floors so you can have a better view and get away from some of the street noise. As I mentioned before, we upgraded to the corner room to get a better view of the city. There are 2 benefits and 1 big drawback to this: The main benefit is the expansive view of 2 sides of the building, and a much larger wraparound balcony. Another benefit is that you supposedly gain an extra 10~20% more space. However, the space you supposedly gain cannot be used. The room is designed to get as much of the useable view as possible in a rectangular area. They do that by putting the bathroom in the middle, so the room actually forms a "U" shape. You enter the room from one end of the U, and the bed is in the other end. The end result is that most of the space is completely wasted and unusable, and the room actually feels smaller than a regular non-corner room. Unless you plan on spending a lot of time on the wraparound balcony, I don't recommend getting the corner room. Other than that, the room is new, clean, and very modern. Bathroom has a separate stall for shower and toilet, and all the fixture feels very solid and nice. Fitness center/spa: Other things we liked about the hotel is the awesome fitness center that spans 2 floors. There's a large 25m outdoor pool that can be wonderful in the summer, and a 2 lane indoor pool that's useful in the Chicago winter. Hot tub is available inside and outside as well adjacent to the pools. On the other level, you have a very large fitness center with all the standard free and fixed weight equipment, as well as a small half-court basketball court. There is also top notch with a roomy Sauna and Steam room and a full service spa that my wife and I really enjoyed. The fitness center and pool is shared with the locals who own/rent the condo/apartment upstairs. All the locals we met were very nice, but I can imagine that after a few years they may get a bit tired of all the hotel guests sharing the facilities with them. There were also a lot of kids running around the fitness center, and the wait time for the elevator seems a bit long at times. Nevertheless, I thought this fitness center is the best of any business-level hotels I've ever stayed at. Restaurant/bars We didn't get to try the Filini restaurant or the room service, but we did try the bar one the first floor. The food/drink/service were all on par with our expectation, but nothing too special. All in all, we really enjoyed the stay at the hotel. There were a few kinks that should be worked out soon (no towels in the fitness center, 2 of the 4 elevator were down for a period of our stay), but I'll definitely come back next time I'm in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing new hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: bfpop
Reviews.Content: This is not your father's Radisson! Bringing the upscale Blu concept to America from Europe, Chicago has gained a world class hotel. From the beautiful architecture to the modern, but whimsical interior design, to the exceptional service, Blu delivers on all levels. The rooms feel more like small apartments, with floor to ceiling windows, undulating balconies, hardwood floors, and modern amenities like a rain shower (with a frosted glass door on industrial tracks). The location is incredible, just a walk from Millennium park, Miracle Mile, and the Navy Pier. The staff was friendly, helpful and accommodating. The check-in person even walked us to the elevator, pointing out some of hotel's features as we went, including the 40 ft long fireplace. The waiters and bartenders in Filini were friendly and entertaining as well. We only were able to stay one night on our anniversary on our way to another destination, but we will definitely make Blu our Chicago go-to hotel now on. By the way, for breakfast in Filini, try their European take on Eggs Benedict, poached eggs (perfect!} on polenta with a thin slice of dry cured ham and of course, hollandaise. Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “First rate professional service with a great location and views”
Reviews.Author: Ernest K
Reviews.Content: Modern style rooms with balconies that expose the guest to great views of Lakeshore East Park. Staff extremely accommadating, friendly and professional. Fitness room enormous with lot's of options. Rooms were squeaky clean (including bath). Very reasonable rates for this newer hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, comfortable and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Amy M
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at Radisson Blu Chicago was excellent. The location is very easy from O'Hare and the exterior is very pretty and welcoming. My suite was perfectly laid out and very clean, fresh and modern. The bathroom is a home run with a huge soaker tub and separate shower. I also liked the linens and toiletries. The best part, however, is the staff. Everyone seemed really happy to be working there and offered gracious and warm service. I would stay again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: P H
Reviews.Content: My fiancee' and I stayed at the Blu Aqua for two nights on New Year's weekend, and we were immediately blown away by the decor of the hotel. Check-in on Dec. 30 was smooth... I tried to upgrade to a corner balcony room, but all Naturally Cool rooms with a balcony were taken. Bummer. We were placed on the 12th floor with a Park view and we were still happy with that. Our room was right near the elevator and it was almost like we had our own personal elevator, which was pretty cool. Our bathroom seemed to be HUGE - with both a tub and a shower.... in a configuration I have not yet seen posted here by other reviewers. We loved it. We did not eat in the restaurant but did visit Filini Bar. We thoroughly enjoyed our cocktails both nights, which were plenty potent for the price. All of the bar staff were very friendly, engaging, and fun - especially on New Year's Eve. One thing I would change would be the bar menu. Offer a few more bar-friendly food options (and also for room service). Parking cost way too much but that's pretty much the climate in Chicago. We often ditched taking advantage of the in-and-out privileges we were paying for and took a cab to the places around downtown we wanted to go instead of paying for more parking each time. The hotel is close to everything we we never paid more than $7 one way to get anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Blue has some great potential with some serious kinks to work out”
Reviews.Author: disc0very
Reviews.Content: We stayed the first weekend of Dec 2011. Pros: - "paperless" hotel + wireless room keys gives the feeling of a modern hotel - the hotel/room decor and beds are great. They are very modern and stylish. - the rainfall shower is amazing - great selection of TV channels including HBO and AMC - Flexible and accommodating with late check-outs - Friendly door men Cons: - Generally there are still kinks to work out - We received an automated wake up call at 4:30am that we didn't schedule, and ruining a bad nights sleep is as bad as it can get for a hotel. When we complained in the morning the receptionist checked the system and confirmed we didn't have a schedule wake up call. She also informed us that other guests also either mistakenly received a call or didn't get called when they were supposed to. The receptionist was apologetic but nothing was really done about it for us and we have no idea if the issue would be resolved. - At check out, we got another receptionist who had no idea what she was doing. She ended up printing the wrong total on the bill three times and needed assistance from another receptionist to finally get it right. When leaving the hotel, I was still worried that our credit card hadn't been charged correctly. In my opinion, the receptionist shouldn't have been learning how to do a check out in front of the customer. - Wifi was basically unusable. Signal strength was good but web pages would time out most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “New with modern decor”
Reviews.Author: Axsdnyd
Reviews.Content: We loved the modern decor and color scheme. This is a new hotel that shares space with a high rise condo. Great city views and within walking distance to shopping and restaurants. Filini's lounge and restaurant served very good food and had one of the largest bars I've seen in a long time. Exercise facilities were top notch featuring free weights, spinning, treadmills and a basketball half court. Not to mention indoor/outdoor pools and sauna with a nice outdoor running track.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jason L
Reviews.Content: The outdoor sun patio is amazing, with BBQ area, fire pits, outdoor & indoor pool, outdoor & indoor hottub. The rooms have awesome decor, and the bathroom is great. Only complaint, is that it takes awhile to get hot water, free wifi in a full service hotel is next to impossible to find (another great feature), free breakfast would have been good, but the hotel is attatched to a CVS, so if you dont want a hot breakfast you can just go there. I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Most Wonderful Stay Ever........”
Reviews.Author: Anne B
Reviews.Content: My first time to Chicago, and I must say I was very very impressed. Chicago is such a fantastic city, and the Radisson Blu was the best hotel I have stayed in. From check in to check out, I was super happy. Right when I walked in, I was greeted by Anita who had a smile on her face during the entire check in process. She personalized the check in by introducing the conceirge who we later used, and all the great details of the hotel!!! She was just fabulous! We were very impressed with the design of the room (it was the room with the carpet). We were dissatified with our view, however. As we were heading downstairs we thought we'd bring it up to the front desk, and Jessica the supervisor. She was the outstanding!! She moved our room immediately without hesitation to a Park View which we were much more satisfied with. Last but not least we went to the concierge and were asking Ruben what exactly we should do being it was our first time in Chicago, and he made a full schedule of things including Navy Pier, the current shows going on in the city, and also made us dinner reservations. He is very knowledgeable about Chicago. And his accent was very cute! Great looking staff! Great location! Absolute beautiful design!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, but...”
Reviews.Author: Susan K
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the new Radisson Blu for New Years Eve. The hotel is lovely and the rooms new and clean. They are nicely decorated but very small. I asked if we could be upgraded to a better room and was surprised if the room we got was better because it was VERY small and the bathroom didnâ€™t have a tub. The room is decorated in very dark colors of black lacquer, black marble floors, teal carpet. We did look into a corner room that was being cleaned before we left and we were much more impressed. Hardwood floors, light, bright and more earth tones. Corner rooms come with a shower and a tub. We only had a shower in our room; I would have loved a tub. The shower in our room comes with a separate shower wand in addition to the overhead spray, but we could not get it to work, something that no doubt will become a problem in the shower after so many people try to make it work and it will eventually break. There was no information anywhere describing how to use it. Radisson is going for a new more upscale market with this hotel but I noticed a few things that I think they should consider to help obtain that appeal because after I stayed I ultimately left feeling like I stayed in a Radisson. 1. Have 2 robes in the room; not just one. Also, don't place a cardboard advertisement around the waist...tacky. 2. Have towels outside the sauna and steam room for guests to use. We could not find any. I guess we were supposed to bring them from our room. There was no information on this either. FYI, both the sauna and the steam room are coed. Also if you plan to sit in the sauna or steam the only place to cool off after you are finished would be to take a quick shower in the locker room, the lap pool is on the third floor. It was a real let down not to be able to have the pool there. 3. In regards to food, a few more options would be nice; maybe a few kids meal items. The hotel has one Italian restaurant and a lobby bar that serves upscale pizza and appetizers (sorta like tapas). It really is a beautiful hotel, in a quiet area of town only a couple blocks off of Michigan Avenue and very close to Navy Pier. Just needs a few adjustments.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago 2011”
Reviews.Author: wpka4
Reviews.Content: What a great new hotel. We had a corner room on the "13" Th. floor. What an outstanding view of Navy Pier and Millenium Park. We were in room 1323 a corner King room. This was our upgrade for $9.00. Parking is a little steep $50.00 for valet in and out service but we did not go out with the car once we checked in because we could walk to almost everything we wanted to do. Would be nice to have refrigerators in room. But we just put our drinks on the balcony to stay cold. Might go back in the summer!

Reviews.Title: “Exciting, very modern hotel with eclectic style, good food”
Reviews.Author: Rene W
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in Radisson Blu Aqua. Our room had a very modern, stylish features combined with eclectic design and attention to detail. A room minibar was available to us as well. As a green tea lover I appreciated the possibility to have organic Rishi tea in room. The room was very spacious with bay windows and a balcony. Bathroom was equipped with rain shower and a tub. Beds are very comfortable. Even though our room was facing east we had a very good view of Millenium Park. The hotel has very helpful staff. The Filini restaurant has attentive servers and serves all kinds of breakfasts which are reasonably priced. The hotel swimming pool has only two lanes but the indoor gym is big, clean and is equipped as a regular gym with free weights, cardio and machines (not a hotel one) with sauna and steam. Conveniently located from public transportation. All downtown attractions can be reached by foot in very short time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - my new favorite place to stay n Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Jack9003
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Blu Aqua hotel is the tallest building in the world designed by a woman. Jeanne Gang, the lead designer on the architecture team, did a beautiful job with this structure and combined innovative structural design with beautiful interiors. This building stands out before you even enter! I loved the rooms - they have wood floors (so smart - why don't hotels have wood floors in general? they are so much more hygienic and beautiful). The room I was in had a gorgeous wrap around balcony, views of downtown, a comfortable soaking tub, elegant bedding and decor, a sense of space and comfort. The hotel also has a lap pool on the third floor and a gym. It is brand new and costs less than the dinosaur hotels in the area. I loved it. 2 small complaints: the parking costs $41. This seems really steep to me given that there is nowhere else to park. And there were lots of kids in the lap pool when I was there. Keep in mind that this really is a lap pool - 2 lanes, 25 yards - just enough room for several swimmers to get a great workout. But one whole lane had kids splashing around. I think this is not a problem in the summer when they have outdoor pools - one lap and one recreational - but in the winter, perhaps the lap pool should be off limits to kids? All in all though, a wonderful stay at a European style hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great two-night stay”
Reviews.Author: moonltnite
Reviews.Content: We just got home from a two-night stay at the Blu Aqua. Overall - the experience was terrific. The staff goes out of their way to be friendly and helpful. We had a Groupon for a king room. I had asked for possible upgrades - including a $9/night for park view. On check-in, we were told we got that upgrade. I'm not positive the view we had was really what was meant by "park view". We were in 1007 - facing north. Looking straight out - we looked into an office building. If we looked right we could see Navy Pier and the river. Looking left - we could see a sliver of the Wrigley building. We did not face the park. I'm not sure if that upgrade included Navy Pier views OR Millenium Park, so we didn't say something. I'm not sure the view we had was worth $9 a night. The room was relatively compact - but nicely laid out. I loved how clean and new it was. There was a wood-laminate floor - with marble floor in the entry area and bathroom. We had a king bed with great bedding. It was very comfortable (though the pillows were rather "mushy" - it was good we had 6 of them). The bathroom was beautiful - with a separate soaking tub and walk in shower. It was also very spacious. The sliding door to the bathroom was fine for us - but I could see if you were sharing a room with someone other than a spouse, it could be a problem privacy-wise. It definitely didn't muffle any noises from the bathroom! The closet area was laid out nicely with three drawers and a good-sized safe. The hanging area, however, was a bit small. It was ok for us for just 2 nights - but for a longer stay with 2 people or more - it'd be tough. There was a good-sized flat screen TV and desk area. The public areas were very nice. We enjoyed the bar - and had breakfast one morning in the restaurant. The food and service were excellent. We didn't use the indoor lap pool and spa or health club. The health club area was very large with great equipment and even a half basketball court. In the lobby area - there were a lot of areas to sit and lounge. We were rather surprised by the $51/night charge for parking. That seems rather high to me, particularly as we didn't use an in/out privileges. I've seen others complain about noise in their rooms. We were close to the elevators and had no issue with that. We also couldn't hear neighbors next to us. I also saw someone complain about it not being kid-friendly. Honestly, it's not the type of hotel I'd choose if we still had small kids. I don't think it's fair for someone to expect it to be child-focused. It was great for the two of us!

Reviews.Title: “Totally disappointed”
Reviews.Author: spmary
Reviews.Content: As I lay in my room right now, I lay very disappointed. The constant dings of the elevators are making me nuts. The room feels to be about 90 degrees with no air circulation. There is NOTHING for my child to eat from room service, the restaurant, nor the bar. It is catered to adults. The pool was freezing, and no towels were available. I don't think there was much upkeep in the pool area, as I fell with all the puddles.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experiance”
Reviews.Author: Miroslava H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over this Christmas with my kids and friend. It was a wonderfull experiance. Hotel is absolutly stunning, amazing service, everything was top-noch. Looking forward to my next stay at this property, and recomend everybody who is looking for hotel in downtown Chiago to stay at Radisson Blue.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Get Away”
Reviews.Author: mrsbdp92
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel, Beautiful View of city , Great workout facilities. Clean, fresh , Peaceful environment. Just had a problem with front desk not informing me of amount incidental charges also strange Restroom door.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome StayCation @ Radisson Blu Aqua”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyerUAL
Reviews.Content: Me and a couple of friends decided to have a girls' weekend out, and wanted to stay downtown. I chose the Radisson Blu because I've stayed at several of them around the world and was excited to see this brand in the U.S. and especially in my hometown Chicago! I decided to park in the garage which was $41/day since we wouldn't be driving. Check-in was quick and easy, and I was told that I was given the upgrade I requested for an extra $9/night. I had room #1002, which was a 2 bed corner room w/ balcony. The room was absolutely amazing, spacious and clean. It had beautiful wooden floors. The room was also equipped with a ipod player/alarm. The views from the balcony were awesome. I really couldn't have asked for anything better. The bathroom was large and had a shower with rain shower head and a large bathtub. I ate down at the Filini bar which was very good also. I had the Marinated tuscan olives as an appetizer, the Niman ranch flat iron steak with arugula, cherry tomatoes & grilled polenta for dinner, and Bomboloni: Amaretti scented doughnuts with 3 sauces for dessert. Overall, our stay was great and I had absolutely no complaints. When anyone asks where to stay when they come to Chicago, I will definitely tell them they must go to the Radisson Blu Aqua!

Reviews.Title: “A delightful night the night-before-the-night-before Christmas.”
Reviews.Author: detailwatcher
Reviews.Content: Purpose for my stay: My wife and I stayed here for our date night/stay-cation. The "feel" of the hotel: the wave design of the "Aqua" tower has quickly become iconic in a city renowned for its iconic buildings. It is undeniably chic. With its clean lines, heavy reliance on white, and dark blue neon accents, the lobby reflects the design aesthetic used throughout the hotel. We stayed on a night that was probably one of their lightest for occupancy. Nonetheless, hotel guests used most of the seating areas in the lobby, which appeared to be quite comfortable. The hotel bar: another example of the super-contemporary design of the hotel, my wife enjoyed spending a few minutes in the bar before heading upstairs for the night. I recommend the cappuccino; it's excellent. The room: we stayed in a corner room with a view of Lake Shore East Park, Navy Pier, and a bit of Streeterville. Our king size bed was comfortable. The layout was a bit unconventional. Upon walking through the doorway, the room's closet was on the immediate left. Straight ahead was the coffee maker/refrigerator setup (in a large cabinet). On the wall above and to the left of the cabinet was a small flat-screen TV that faced the desk and chair (on your right as you walk in from the doorway). The bathroom was beautiful. Lots of frosted glass, new fixtures, and lots of space. The tub appeared spacious, but was unused. The separate shower was great. The room had a wrap-around balcony, too. The aesthetic of the room reminded me a bit of high end Ikea. Although it's a beautiful space, it does not have much embellishment. I am hesitant to call it spartan, but the emphasis on white, cool blues, and blonde wood floors and cabinets is undoubtedly minimalist. Service: The hotel staff was superb. The evening manager who checked us in escorted us to the elevator, which was a nice touch. Overall impressions: I think this hotel would be excellent for business travelers. For a romantic weekend in Chicago, it's a bit cold, unless you are really "into" modern architecture. The service was great, and the views were fantastic. It was an excellent visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great building”
Reviews.Author: Hectorsmom
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Blu hotel, which is in the architecturally stunning Aqua building. The location is convenient to Millennium park and Michigan avenue. The views depend on which room you have, but you can walk around the building and observe the exterior details up close. The interior is very modern, with many unique touches. The room itself was somewhat small, and the lighting leaves something to be desired. On the whole, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: dickandjackie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brand new, it opened on October 2011. We were fortunate to find the primo hotel with a Groupon. The hotel is ultra modern. They have one of the most plush lobbies I have ever seen. Our room was of great design. Very contemporary room with real HD viewing. The bathroom design was the most ingenious. Good view of Navy pier. The fitness center was the best I have seen at any Chicago hotel. Real swim lanes. This hotel has moved up to the top of my list in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel with some growing pains”
Reviews.Author: tman12
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the new Radisson Blu. It had opened 4 weeks earlier. It is a beautiful hotel. The lobby, bar, sleeping rooms are well appointed and modern. The bathroom was one of the nicest that I have seen with a rain shower head and glass door. The location is good, a block away from Michigan Avenue and the river. It is right behind the Hyatt hotel on Columbus Avenue. Everything was top notched and we got a great rate, since they were trying to get people to stay there. They have a nice work out facility with good weight room and cardio area. They have a great indoor lap pool and jacuzzi. There is a co-ed steam room and sauna. Here were the issues with the hotel. The check in was slow. There was only 1 attendant checking in guests. The wait wasnt long, but it was 12 minutes before we were helped. The rooms were very nice, but I opened a glass drawer and it was covered in construction dust, as was a desk drawer. If you go use the pool, you have to bring your own towels. The fitness center is for the apartment dwellers that are above the hotel. This is not mentioned in the hotel information. Also they say that self parking is $41, that is only if you don't move your car. You can not take it in and out or you will be charged more than $41. Again they didnt mention it in the hotel information. My first night cost me $64, which is outrageous. Apparently, the parking is controlled by the apartment complex, so they have no say at the Radisson on this. At least that is what I was told. We also had bad service at the lobby bar, but I wont go into that, the women was probably having a bad night, because the bar was empty. Warning: the hotel is right next door to the Chicago Fire Deparment and the sirens go all night and day. The sound proofing in the hotel is pretty good, but not enough to cover a loud siren. I think this will be a great hotel to stay at one day, if they grow up and learn how to run the hotel as one would expect for a hotel of this caliber. I would try it again, if the price is right

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: PracticingTourist
Reviews.Content: Great location by Millennium Park, nice view of Navy Pier. Clean, comfortable and quite room. Very nice to have a balcony in Chicago, staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Wireless connection was a bit spotty. I stay in Chicago at least 9 or 10 times a year, the Radisson Blu Aqua is now my favorite- the price and location are great.

Reviews.Title: “European Style and Service in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: fififlies
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a stay in Barcelona, my husband and I couldn't help but make favorable comparisons to the Radisson Blue Aqua in Chicago. The ambiance is European modern with outstanding interior design, art and lighting. The public spaces were a delight to the eye and the bar and restaurant were truly outstanding. The service was attentive and professional with all of our wants anticipated without having to ask. We loved our King Suite. The decor was crisp, modern and well thought out. My husband commented at the end of our visit that we needn't go to Europe for exquisite design and service---it can be found at the Radisson Blu Aqua an hour's plane ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience at new Chicago hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richard K
Reviews.Content: Fine service and product at Radisson Blu Aqua Hotel. From the greeting at the door, to the reception desk, to the staff in the bar and restaurant; the service and attentiveness was excellent. The hotel room was spacious, sleek, modern, and well laid out. The food (small plates) in the bar and the breakfast were very well prepared, excellent food quality, and enjoyable. Compares favorably to the best hotels in the city. All in all, a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice new hotel”
Reviews.Author: saxorob
Reviews.Content: A nice addition to the Chicago hotel scene. Rooms are a little small, and I could use more in-room lighting (I think part of the boutique effect they're trying to create), but appointed very nicely. Restaurant in lobby is really quite good too!

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel in upscale loop location”
Reviews.Author: bpmeier
Reviews.Content: This hotel (located at 225 n Columbus not 221) opened Nov 1 2011 and can best be described as euro-chic. Mod interiors in nice sized rooms each with a balcony and decent if not awesome view. The hotel shares amenities with the condo above which is a bonus: oversized health club, indoor and outdoor pools. Easy walking distance to Millennium Park, Navy Pier and the Mag Mile. Watch for specials and discounts for great value stays!

Reviews.Title: “Staff is especially excellent”
Reviews.Author: iowastate89
Reviews.Content: Stayed on weekend of 12/9. The rooms seem to be split into two types, a more natural wood, and then a very modern "mansion" style (it's interesting, but not quite in our taste). My wife needs a bath, and the staff was very gracious in accommodating our request (which resulted in a change to the more neutral style which we preferred). The design is very interesting, especially the lobby area. We had a family gathering, and the kids (ages 6-to-15) all really enjoyed it, along with access to the pool and a very excellent gym. The bathroom design is not perfect; in our case a sliding door was the main barrier from the bath to the living area of the room and it is not exactly a full seal, ha. Not a huge problem, but not a ton of privacy either. Oh well, our 6 year old didn't mind too much. The restaurant was great in our opinion, with the menu being quite good and not overly expensive (in my opinion, especially for breakfast vs. the Fairmont across the street which I personally think is very overpriced). Our room was fairly quiet, especially considering we were close to an elevator. I slept fairly soundly, and usually we don't sleep all that well in hotels on the first night. Obviously being brand new, the room was spotless and super clean. The best part was truly the staff. All weekend, EVERY staff member (and I mean everyone, even random bellboys we met handling luggage on the elevators) seemed genuinely proud of the new hotel and wanted us to have a good visit. They couldn't have been more friendly and that made for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay some newer hotel issues still to be ironed out.”
Reviews.Author: cllong
Reviews.Content: Loved the look and feel of this hotel. From the start everyone who worked here was extremely friendly. Some small issues with no soaps in the shower and items missing in the mini fridge but that was not enough to take away from the sleek newness of the hotel and the comfort of the room. And its the hubbys new favorite spot.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and modern”
Reviews.Author: BuckyBadger123
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this hotel, especially for being open less than a month. The building itself is an architectural wonder and the interior is beautiful to match. The lobby features a classic brick wall, contrasted by a modern fireplace wall. The front desk is unobtrusively set off to the side, and you almost don't see it when walking in. I stayed in a "Naturally cool" room, which was very bright and well laid out. There was plenty of storage space. The mattress was very comfortable and the linens very soft and fresh. The bath featured separate tub and shower as well as dual flush toilet. My only complaints with the room were that the bathroom door was a slider and didn't seem to shut completely and that there is only one towel rack on the shower door and no hooks from which to hang towels. The pool was a nice two lane lap pool. The whirlpool was very small, however. Even with the outdoor pool and whirlpool open during summer, I can see these areas being very crowded. Also, there were no towels in the pool area. We had to go up to the room to grab some and then this shorted us in the room after a shower. I mentioned this towel issue and they said they are working on a fix for the pool towels. The are many Eco- conscious friendly features in the hotel, from the motion sensitive lights that to the dual flush toilet. Additionally, the hotel information is on the TV rather than printed out, saving reprints when some of the information changes. Once this property gets over it's opening issues, it will be among the best in Chicago. The location with views of Navy Pier, Millennium Park and it's close proximity (2 blocks) from Michigan Avenue, make it a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed building, service, and location”
Reviews.Author: scoobrs
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend in Chicago on a Groupon voucher. The location was excellent. Blu Aqua is less than a block from Millenium Park and the Chicago Art Institute. The room was immaculate and modern. It's really a beautiful building inside and out. Everything worked. No surprises on the bill. The Filini bar had excellent, Italian-inspired food and drink. There were minor issues. The shower can be susceptible to overflowing due to its design. The elevator bank marked as working seemed to change each day (the hotel's less than a month old). There seemed to be a limit of one wifi device per room. If you can't handle sirens, don't stay downtown because EVERY hotel I've ever stayed at in downtown Chicago is in the vicinity of a police station, fire station, or hospital. However, the stay was at least as pleasant as any other I've had at a good four-star hotel in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “One of Chicagoâ€™s Best”
Reviews.Author: Aurora100
Reviews.Content: I travel to Chicago a couple of times a year on business and have stayed at many different hotels there. My favorite has always been the Park Hyatt, although Iâ€™ve only stayed there once, as I try to be somewhat budget conscious. My new favorite is the Radisson Blu, and the good news is that itâ€™s a lot cheaper than the Park Hyatt. Upon check-in, I was upgraded to a corner room with a balcony. The room was huge with beautiful hardwood floors and light wood furniture. The had a real Nordic minimalist design, which I really like. The bathroom was sleek and modern with a separate shower stall. As much as I always enjoy walking around Chicago, I would have been happy just staying in the room on this trip! An added bonus was that there was free Wi-Fi in the rooms. Other upscale hotels should take notice! However there are too many diversions within the hotel to stay in your room. Thereâ€™s a very sleek looking bar on the first floor that was pretty busy even on a weeknight. Upstairs from the bar is a modern Italian restaurant that has good food, and although I read poor reviews concerning their service, the night I was there it was pretty good. To work off your big meal, there is a mini indoor basketball court; a tw0- lane indoor 25 yard lap pool, a real gym with lots of equipment (compared to most tiny hotel gyms), and in the summer an outdoor lap pool. I donâ€™t think Iâ€™ve ever seen a hotel with such comprehensive fitness facilities. At this hotel the fitness facilities are even better than those at most Four Seasons Hotels, which are typically pretty good. The location of the hotel is right up the street from Millennium Park and maybe a 6-minute walk to the Magnificent Mile. While I prefer the location of hotels that are just west of North Michigan Avenue, this location still pretty decent, and the hotel was so nice that it was worth the extra walk. Note that not all of the rooms have balconies or hard wood floors. One of my work colleagues had a room that had very bright blue carpeting, which she wasnâ€™t crazy about. So, if you want a certain type of room, you should request it. Rates are really reasonable right now; Iâ€™m not sure if it is because the hotel is brand new. In any case, the price is right, at least for the time beingâ€”the Radisson Blu Aqua is not only a great hotel but a great value. To be honest, I was almost hesitant to write this review, because Iâ€™m afraid this place will become too popular!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish European Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JimRiesterer
Reviews.Content: Recently we visited Chicago for a holiday shopping weekend and decided to stay at Radisson Blu at Aqua. The hotel is brand new. We had a suite on the 16th floor that had a large sitting area, desk, king-sized bed and large, modern bathroom with a large tub and a separate large rain shower. The room also had a small balcony with a view of Millenial park one block away although it was too cold to go out on it during our visit. The hotel also has a nice Italian restaurant, Felini that we enjoyed, and a great lobby bar with a pizza oven. We enjoyed the location, just a short walk to all the holiday activities on State St and Michigan Ave. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Check your credit card”
Reviews.Author: bbroke7
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel but being that it is new they have some issues. Double charged me at regular price of the room for a trip I pre-paid through orbitz. Still haven't taken care of the billing issue.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy T
Reviews.Content: We just spent a night at the Radisson Blu Chicago and were so impressed we'd return in heartbeat. Can't wait, in fact. The room was spotless and beautiful and the hotel staff warm, Â courteous and helpful. Â The lobby bar is dazzling and the hotel is just a few blocks from Michigan Avenue and the Art Institute. Â Loved our view of Navy Pier. Â It doesn't hurt that the hotel is housed in one of the most acclaimed skyscrapers in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay!”
Reviews.Author: sara s
Reviews.Content: I have never been to Chicago before and had to come on business. First, the city is the coolest city I have traveled to in the US. Architecture is fantastic, the way the city is laid out, everything, absolutely loved it. The Radisson Blu Aqua was one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in--the second I stepped out of the cab, I was impressed with the level of service from the lovely doorman to the concierge to the front desk staff. Everyone had a smile, was very knowledgeable and genuine. The hotel is beautifully designed and decorated--posh and modern with a beautiful lobby. It's very clean, the rooms are beautiful and clean as well, and guest services was very responsive to all of my needs.The gym is amazing--I was super impressed and was actually excited to work out. I was in town on business and had a million questions on how to get places. The front desk staff was very helpful and even when they didn't know the answer to something, went above and beyond to help. As I was typing this, the front desk girl just came over and handed me printed directions on how to get to the train station for me to make my flight in a few hours, and walked me through everything. I have to say that every person I've encountered in Chicago, from the cab drivers to restaurant managers and servers, have been wonderfully helpful, polite and just plain pleasant. Much, much different than NY or DC! I will tell my company to make this their preferred hotel in Chicago and I hope you do too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the Radisson Blu Aqua”
Reviews.Author: TerriBerry123
Reviews.Content: I had the wonderful opportunity to stay at The Radisson Blu Aqua Hotel in Chicago Illinois for several nights and loved the location to Michigan Ave, the lakeshore, Water Tower, and virtually any sights that are a must for visitors to the Chicago area. Would stay there again for sure! Bathrooms were unique with rainshowers and the beds were extremely comfortable. Terri Young

Reviews.Title: “Great new downtown Chicago hotel!”
Reviews.Author: moritti23
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Radisson Blu Aqua hotel over Thanksgiving weekend and were not disappointed! I love the sleek, modern design. The staff were all very friendly and accommodating. The rooms were really nice and the beds very comfortable. I loved the rain shower and the european shower option ~ great water pressure. The Anne Sedonin amenities were great - I stayed in the Radisson Blu in Paris in April and enjoyed the same lemony amenities.
