The location of the hotel was great ~ very close to Michigan and Navy Pier. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gpm55
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located about 7 blocks from Daley Plaza, but only 1 block from Millennium Park. We stayed in Room 507 for one night (king) and really liked the hardwood floor (marble in bathroom). The second night we stayed in Room 1303 (2 queen beds) with an aqua blue carpet in the bedroom area and granite with silvery sparkles in entry and bathroom. Both rooms were extremely quiet, the mattresses were super comfortable, we enjoyed the Cuisinart brewer, the flat screen TV in both rooms was large and wall mounted at a level providing excellent viewing from bed, iHome dock for iPhone or iPod/clock/alarm/CHARGING STATION was nice to have. The indoor pool and whirlpool were quite nice, but we imagine the larger outdoor pool in Summer will be even nicer. We ate at both Fellini's Bar and Restaurant during our stay and enjoyed both - with prices that seemed in line for such a nice establishment in Downtown Chicago. Staff were efficient and helpful. The modern public areas were absolutely stunning!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend”
Reviews.Author: mamabebe
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel using an online service that doesn't reveal name of hotel until it is booked. What a pleasant surprise! I didn't know this hotel was open. It is beautiful -- looks like waves of water from the outside and the water theme is carried on inside. The carpet in our room looked like the ocean in the Caribbean. Very quiet, plush, lots of techy gadgets. We ate a light dinner consisting of pizza and wine in the bar before the theater and then had brunch in the morning. What a delight! The food was delicious and the servers friendly and eager to please. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Some childhood diseases to be fixed, but very promising”
Reviews.Author: EgonOlsen
Reviews.Content: First of all impression is really great - fantastic design, great location, modern architecture. Everything is really top of the notch. We arrived at 11PM, received the keys, opened the doors, and... surprise! Room was either not made up yet, or somebody was still occupying it. We came back to the front desk, and I must admit I was pleasantly surprised with immediate reaction - we received another, corner room which was really great. Nice furniture, very good sleep quality, nice atmosphere. I liked it very much. Coming to the childhood diseases: room was made for one person. At midnight I didn't want to complain and request all this stuff - I thought it'll be done next day. Unfortunately housekeeping did nothing to fix this, and as somebody mentioned before was almost not existent. Also lights steering worked only manually. Other than this everything was just perfect. After some fine-tuning it'll be one of the best places to stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: SwissMr
Reviews.Content: Stupendous building in Chicago. Will only get better and better. This building is unbelievable. Definitely not for the kids, but for rather business traveler or adult couple getaway. Swanky and pricey, but well worth the extra expense. When you arrive you will see this is Adult time only and for good reason. Awesome restaurant with an incredible wine selection, and in the heart of the Millennium Park /Art Institute section of the Loop

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with one exception”
Reviews.Author: rovworld
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, the building is stunning and the location couldn't be better. The hotel has a sleek interior design with fun touches throughout (like the Chicago skyline painted on the walls of the guest room floors). The rooms were nicely designed and very comfortable, and the pillows were plentiful and plushy. One big problem was with the showers. They were so poorly designed! You have to step inside to turn on the water, so you get drenched with cold water for several minutes. It's hard to figure out how to switch from the ceiling nozzle to the handheld one, and if you turn on the handheld nozzle while it is mounted on the wall the water shoots straight out, hits the shower door, and goes all over the floor. This hotel is the first of its kind in North America - - I hope they work out the kinks in any others that they build. One other small thing, there is no protective plate on the door, so if you keep it open using the latch it will scuff up the door. Fortunately that is fairly easy to resolve - - the plumbing problem isn't.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property with so much promise!”
Reviews.Author: ErinGaster
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the new Raddison Blu Aqua Hotel this week in Chicago while attending a conference. The architecture of the building is stunning, the facade looks like pools of moving water. It is modern chic inside, the rooms are spacious and very nice. I would stay here again for sure however there were a few growing pain problems as the hotel opened on October 31st, 2011. I would think, however, that is to be expected with a brand new hotel. Friendly staff, central location in the Millenium Park area, close to Michigan Avenue and the good shopping. Lake and river a short walk, great running trails on the river. Did the Architecture River Tour, which was suprisingly very interesting and well worth the $30 and 1.5 hours of my time. Overall an 8 out of ten, just because of the "brand new" issues we experienced. I am sure the next time I stay there it will be a 10/10.

Reviews.Title: “May be too early for accurate review”
Reviews.Author: threeputzzz
Reviews.Content: This hotel just opened a couple weeks ago and is going through minor growing pains I think. One of the only 2 hotel elevators close to the lobby was not working. There were no towels at the indoor pool and when the guy arrived with them there was nowhere to put them. He volume control on our TV jumped from 9 to 16, we could not set it at a comfortable level. They could definitely use better access from the self park garage to the lobby, right now it's kind of a maze. The place is set up for the valet parking. The height clearance in the garage is not 9 feet as they told us on the phone before our trip as our box top carrier has many new gouges and scratches on it from the signs and pipes hanging from the ceiling. All these issues I can write off to the place being so new. The one issue that I cannot excuse however were the charges that showed up on our bill for room service and mini fridge items when we didn't use either. They removed them without delay but that's one mistake that is a major red flag in my book. Even if it was an innocent error it leaves me with the impression that they were hoping to make a few extra $$ from me if I didn't take the time to check my bill. Now the positives: Great location, good value when compared to other nice hotels in the area, modern room decor, reminded me of IKEA style furnishings very nicely done. Outstanding workout facility, game room with pool and poker tables and half basketball court. Very friendly and helpful staff. A note on lounge prices - ask for 2 glasses of house red at the bar and get a bill for $26. Not being a regular guest of hotel bars I have no idea if that is typical or not. I'll give this place another visit at a later date (unless the prices go up much).

Reviews.Title: “Very good room, better dining”
Reviews.Author: TallyBill
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to this area, so I don't have anything to compare it to. However, this was a positive experience from check in to check out. Even though the rainy weather prevented us from exploring the area, dining in the hotel was a pleasant surprise. You can run up a bill if you want to, but you can also have a great meal at a reasonable price. I would stay here again whether for business or pleasure. For me, the staff is what makes the difference, and this staff was very efficient and friendly. Ask for Anastaysia when you dine at Filini!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelReine
Reviews.Content: We were guests on day one or two of their opening. Our room was beautiful and immaculate. Well designed. Appropriately beyond expectations. The service was wonderful. Most all staff worked overtime to meet our needs. The hotel (bar and restaurants) were reflective of planning, imagination, beauty and exemplary taste. The food (we bought the lamb, "Wednesday's," special meal of the day) was fantastic. The bar was beautiful, intimate and gorgeous. The service reflected awareness, concern and support. This is a new hotel, going through minor growing pains, that is destined to become one of the top hotels in Chicago. Get in while you have a chance. MLF, Holderness, NH
